SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Bill
Record representing a bill.
BillDAO
Data Access Object for handling database operations related to bills.
Client
Represents a client in the system.
ClientBL
Business logic class for managing client operations.
ClientDAO
Data Access Object specifically for handling database operations related to the Client entity.
ClientValidator
The ClientValidator class is responsible for validating client operations, ensuring that a client exists before an operation is performed.
ConnectionFactory
Factory class for managing database connections.
Controller
Controller for managing GUI interactions and delegating business logic operations.
EmailValidator
The EmailValidator class is responsible for validating email addresses using a regular expression pattern to ensure they meet specific formatting requirements.
GenericDAO<T>
Abstract generic Data Access Object (DAO) class that provides the common functionality for all DAO classes.
Main
The Main class serves as the entry point for the application.
Order
Represents an order in the system.
OrderBL
Business logic class for managing orders.
OrderDAO
Data Access Object specifically for handling database operations related to the Order entity.
OrderIdValidator
The OrderIdValidator class is responsible for validating whether an order ID is unique within the system before a new order is added to avoid conflicts.
Product
Represents a product in the system.
ProductBL
Business logic class for managing product operations.
ProductDAO
Data Access Object specifically for handling database operations related to the Product entity.
ProductValidator
The ProductValidator class is responsible for validating product-related operations, ensuring that the product exists in the system and that there is sufficient quantity available for transactions.
QuantityValidator
The QuantityValidator class is responsible for ensuring that quantities used in business operations are valid, specifically that they are greater than zero.
View
The View class manages the graphical user interface components for handling clients, products, and orders in a desktop application.
